page.title: 14RECREATION-HOBBIES&INTERESTS
page.content: In our survey of children and adults in Harbury we discovered that 95% had a hobby or special interest. The most popular hobby is football which attracted 27% of the boys' vote. When asked they said they got a lot of enjoyment from it and many said one day they hoped to play for their favourite football clubs. Tennis was the most popular sport for girls because of the strong Junior Tennis Club in Harbury. The hobbies ranged from pebble collecting to bird watching, wind surfing to bee keeping. Most people spent between l and 6 hours per week on their interest. Some hobbies were expensive particularly when special equipment had to be bought. Some people had only begun their interest in the last few months - one man had been bee keeping for 49 years.
